quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: But there was no need to be ashamed of tears, for tears bore witness that a man had the greatest of courage, the courage to suffer.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Between stimulus and response, there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Love is the only way to grasp another human being in the innermost core of his personality.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: An abnormal reaction to an abnormal situation is normal behavior.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: What is to give light must endure burning.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: Each man is questioned by life; and he can only answer to life by answering for his own life; to life he can only respond by being responsible.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: So live as if you were living already for the second time and as if you had acted the first time as wrongly as you are about to act now!
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Forces beyond your control can take away everything you possess except one thing, your freedom to choose how you will respond to the situation.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: It is not freedom from conditions, but it is freedom to take a stand toward the conditions.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Man does not simply exist but always decides what his existence will be, what he will become the next moment.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: For the world is in a bad state, but everything will become still worse unless each of us does his best.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: A man's concern, even his despair, over the worthwhileness of life is an existential distress but by no means a mental disease.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Man is originally characterized by his "search for meaning" rather than his "search for himself."
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: What man actually needs is not a tensionless state but rather the striving and struggling for some goal worthy of him.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: To suffer unecessarily is masochistic rather than heroic.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: The point is not what we expect from life, but rather what life expects from us.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: A life of short duration...could be so rich in joy and love that it could contain more meaning than a life lasting eighty years.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: It is a peculiarity of man that he can only live by looking to the future.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Since Auschwitz we know what man is capable of. And since Hiroshima we know what is at stake.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Human potential at its best is to transform a tragedy into a personal triumph, to turn one's predicament into a human achievement.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: No-one will be able to make us believe that man is a sublimated animal once we can show that within him there is a repressed angel.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: The immediate influence of behavior is always more effective than that of words.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: Don’t aim at success—the more you aim at it and make it a target, the more you are going to miss it.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: I see three possible sources for meaning: in work (doing something significant), in love (caring for another person), and in courage during difficult times.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: If you treat people to a vision of themselves, if you apparently overrate them, you make them become what they are capable of becoming.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: In other words, self-actualization is possible only as a side-effect of self-transcendence.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning

quote: He noticed that it was the men who comforted others and who gave away their last piece of bread who survived the longest – and who offered proof that everything can be taken away from us except the ability to choose our attitude in any given set of circumstances.
author: Viktor E. Frankl, Man's Search for Meaning
